pullRequest.body:
Given an equivalence `e : α ≃ β` and `s : Finset β`, restrict `e` to an equivalence from `e ⁻¹' s` to `s`.

 ---

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

The code looks reasonable, but I don't think `frestrict` is an ideal name; it would be nice to have a name which is a bit more self-explanatory. It's a pity `Equiv.codRestrict` already exists; IMHO the new declaration has a better claim to the name than the existing one, but others might differ on that. Perhaps `Equiv.restrictPreimage`?

I renamed it to `frestrictPreimage` in case someone wants to add a `Set` version later. Also there is [Equiv.image](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Logic/Equiv/Set.html#Equiv.image) which is roughly the same but for image and sets, but `Equiv.fpreimage` seems a bit weird to me.
Why the `f`?
Because it is about finsets.
Is this abbreviation a standard usage in mathlib? I haven't encountered it before.
It is similar to [Preorder.frestrictLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Restriction.html#Preorder.frestrictLe).

I've never seen it anywhere else and [Preorder.frestrictLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Restriction.html#Preorder.frestrictLe) was introduced by me so I don't think it is standard no.
Then maybe `restrictPreimageFinset` might be better?
It seems a bit lengthy to me but if you don't like `frestrictPreimage` I don't have anything better to propose.

Oh, that's not a long name by mathlib standards! We have monsters like [Orientation.oangle_eq_iff_eq_norm_div_norm_smul_rotation_of_ne_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Geometry/Euclidean/Angle/Oriented/Rotation.html#Orientation.oangle_eq_iff_eq_norm_div_norm_smul_rotation_of_ne_zero) or [AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.StructureSheaf.structurePresheafInCommRing_obj_carrier](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/ProjectiveSpectrum/StructureSheaf.html#AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.StructureSheaf.structurePresheafInCommRing_obj_carrier), I'm sure we can live with `Equiv.restrictPreimageFinset`

LGTM now, thanks! Looking forward to the "products of measure spaces" PR that this depends on. 

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13967888779/job/39102429852)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13967888779/job/39102429458)
can't `@[simps]` or `[simps!]` do this automatically?
Oh I did not know that was what `simps` is used for, thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: corestrict an equivalence to a finset

source.title: feat: infinite product of probability measures

nodes.body: The code looks reasonable, but I don't think `frestrict` is an ideal name; it would be nice to have a name which is a bit more self-explanatory. It's a pity `Equiv.codRestrict` already exists; IMHO the new declaration has a better claim to the name than the existing one, but others might differ on that. Perhaps `Equiv.restrictPreimage`?

I renamed it to `frestrictPreimage` in case someone wants to add a `Set` version later. Also there is [Equiv.image](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Logic/Equiv/Set.html#Equiv.image) which is roughly the same but for image and sets, but `Equiv.fpreimage` seems a bit weird to me.
Why the `f`?
Because it is about finsets.
Is this abbreviation a standard usage in mathlib? I haven't encountered it before.
It is similar to [Preorder.frestrictLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Restriction.html#Preorder.frestrictLe).

I've never seen it anywhere else and [Preorder.frestrictLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Restriction.html#Preorder.frestrictLe) was introduced by me so I don't think it is standard no.
Then maybe `restrictPreimageFinset` might be better?
It seems a bit lengthy to me but if you don't like `frestrictPreimage` I don't have anything better to propose.

Oh, that's not a long name by mathlib standards! We have monsters like [Orientation.oangle_eq_iff_eq_norm_div_norm_smul_rotation_of_ne_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Geometry/Euclidean/Angle/Oriented/Rotation.html#Orientation.oangle_eq_iff_eq_norm_div_norm_smul_rotation_of_ne_zero) or [AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.StructureSheaf.structurePresheafInCommRing_obj_carrier](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/ProjectiveSpectrum/StructureSheaf.html#AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.StructureSheaf.structurePresheafInCommRing_obj_carrier), I'm sure we can live with `Equiv.restrictPreimageFinset`

LGTM now, thanks! Looking forward to the "products of measure spaces" PR that this depends on.
